it.polimi.group03.engine

Class GameEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.group03.engine.GameEngine

  • public class GameEngine
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is the one in charge of performing all related things to the mechanics of the game. Should be used when one of the following actions is required:
    • Start a new game.
    • Add a player to a game.
    • Put a bead on the board.
    • Perform a move.
    • Obtain the winner.

    This class fully depends on the Game class to store some values of the game such as: the players, the movements, the beads, and the general state of the game. Makes use of the GameValidator for checking the rules.

    Since:
    11/11/2015.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    cecibloom, megireci, tatibloom
    See Also:
    Game, GameValidator

    • Method Detail

      • addBeadToBoard

        public StatusMessage addBeadToBoard(Player player,
                           Bead bead)
        This method adds a new bead for the selected player if and only if it complies with the rules established by the Game.

        Refer to the GameValidator.validatePlacedBead(Player, Bead) method for further information about the validation and object returned.

        Parameters:
        player - the current player who is making the move
        bead - bead to be placed on the board
        Returns:
        statusMessage indicating the result of the operation. This object contains a code which specifies the code of the error if any and a rCode with a brief description.
        See Also:
        GameValidator, Player, StatusMessage

      • addPlayer

        public StatusMessage addPlayer(Player player)
        This method adds a new player to the game if and only if it complies with the rules established by the Game.

        Refer to the GameValidator.validateNumberOfPlayers() method for further information about the validation and object returned.

        Parameters:
        player - new player to be added to the game
        Returns:
        statusMessage indicating the result of the operation. This object contains a code which specifies the code of the error if any and a rCode with a brief description.
        See Also:
        GameValidator, Player, StatusMessage

      • getGame

        public Game getGame()

      • getNextPlayer

        private Player getNextPlayer(Player player)
        This method retrieves the next player in the game. If there is only one player left in the game the method will return a null value, because it'd mean that the game has finished.
        Parameters:
        player - the current player who is making the move
        Returns:
        player if there is any player left in the game besides the player making the move. null if there is no player next in turn.
        See Also:
        Game, Player

      • getWinner

        public Player getWinner()
        This method checks whether there is a winner or not, there is a winner only when the game has finished, in this case the method retrieves the winning player.
        Returns:
        player the winner if there is any. null if there is no winner yet.
        See Also:
        Game

      • isGameEndConditionReached

        public boolean isGameEndConditionReached()
        This method checks if there is only one player active in the game after a move has been made, which indicates that the game has reached the end. This method should be called from the UI to update the final result and show it to the players.
        Returns:
        true if the are only 1 or 0 players remaining in the game false if there is more than one player in the game.
        See Also:
        Game

      • isRoundFinished

        private boolean isRoundFinished(Player player)
        This method checks whether the current round has finished or not. It is necessary to give the current player as an input so the validation can review if there is any other player active after the player in turn.
        Parameters:
        player - the current player who is making the move
        Returns:
        true if the round has finished. false if the round has not finished yet.
        See Also:
        Game, Player

      • makeMove

        public StatusMessage makeMove(int id,
                     BarOrientation orientation,
                     BarPosition targetPosition,
                     Player currentPlayer)
        This method should be called when a player tries to make a move, before refreshing the state of the game, it will perform a validation according to the rules established for the game. If the move is permitted then some changes are made: the new position of the bar is set, the board is refresh with the new values after the movement of the bar, the beads placed on the board are refresh in the case of any falling off the board, the turn is moved and also the round if is the case.

        Whenever the move is made without any problem the method returns a valid response so the controller can ask for the result of the movement i.e check for any loser.

        Refer to the GameValidator.validateMove(Bar, BarPosition, Player) method for further information about the validation and object returned.

        Parameters:
        id - Moved bar id
        orientation - Moved bar orientation
        targetPosition - Moved bar position (target position)
        currentPlayer - Player making move
        Returns:
        statusMessage indicating the result of the operation. This object contains a code which specifies the code of the error if any and a rCode with a brief description.
        See Also:
        Game, GameValidator, StatusMessage

      • startGame

        public void startGame()
        This method initializes some attributes in order the prepare the game for the start. This method initializes the board, configure the bars, also initializes the lists that will contain the bars move during the game. Should be called whenever a new game is wanted.
        See Also:
        Game
